content.rendered:
Skip the walk in clinic in Nunavut. See the doctor online.

Instantly connect with Canadian doctors for medical care from your phone, tablet, or computer – any time, 24/7.

  • This field is for validation purposes and should be left unchanged.
Describe the details of your visit today.




I woke up with my typical UTI symptoms. I seem to get them all the time. Can you help?


See the doctor now
I woke up with my typical UTI symptoms. I seem to get them all the time. Can you help?
1:00 pm
A doctor will be with you in approx 2 mins
Sorry you’re not feeling well. Would you prefer to video chat?

Yes, video sounds great.

Prescription for Macrobid

We’ll send a notification as soon as the pharmacy has your prescription.

“Virtual medicine isn’t new, but the Maple app takes things to a new level!” – CTV News

Online doctors in Nunavut

Nunavut is the newest, largest, and most northern territory in all of Canada. It’s one of the most sparsely populated regions on earth, with nearly 36,000 people spread over just under two million square kilometres.

There is only one hospital to serve Nunavut, which is located in Iqaluit, as well as two community health centres. There’s also a noted shortage of healthcare workers in this territory. That’s why we created Maple — to make online health care accessible in Nunavut and the rest of Canada.

Looking to see a doctor online in Nunavut? We’re here to help. With Maple you can get a diagnosis, medical advice, or online prescription in Nunavut in minutes. All this, from the comfort of your home.

Chat with a doctor now

Proudly featured in:

How it works.

1. Describe your symptoms through our app

Open the app and click the “See the doctor” button. One of our doctors will review your request and respond in minutes.

Learn more

2. Chat with a doctor

Next, you’ll be connected to the doctor. You can have your consultation by text, video or audio chat in the Maple app.

Learn more

3. Get a diagnosis or prescription

Doctors can diagnose and provide prescriptions as necessary during your consultation.

Learn more

A hand picked network of doctors ready to help you.

We have a national network of Canadian doctors who are licensed to treat you in Nunavut. All of our doctors practice family or emergency medicine right here in Canada.

Meet our doctors

Conditions Maple doctors can treat

Acute care

Our doctors see and treat many common medical issues on Maple.

Some examples include:

  • Biliary colic/ Gallbladder attack
  • Bites & stings
  • Body aches
  • Bronchitis
  • Cough
  • Cold
  • Cold Sores
  • Croup
  • Dehydration
  • Diarrhea
  • Diverticulitis
  • Earache
  • Fever
  • Frostbite
  • Flu (Influenza)
  • Gallstones
  • Gout
  • Hemorrhoids
  • Hiatal Hernia
  • Hives
  • Hypoglycemia
  • Kidney infection
  • Kidney stones
  • Lice
  • Lupus
  • Migraines
  • Mononucleosis
  • Nail infections
  • Nasal congestion
  • Nausea & vomiting
  • Pink eye
  • Pinworm
  • Pneumonia
  • Rashes
  • Respiratory infections
  • Ringworm
  • Scabies
  • Shingles
  • Sinus infections
  • Sore throat
  • Sprains & minor injuries
  • Strep throat
  • Stye
  • Tuberculosis
  • and more…
Chronic care

Doctors are available 24/7 to provide advice and prescriptions for common chronic care conditions.

Some examples include:

  • Acne
  • Allergies
  • Anemia
  • Asthma
  • Atopic Dermatitis
  • Breast Cancer
  • Contact Dermatitis
  • COPD
  • Crohn’s Disease
  • Diabetes
  • Dyshidrotic Eczema
  • Eating Disorders
  • Eczema
  • Fibromyalgia
  • Gastritis
  • High blood pressure
  • High cholesterol
  • Hyperthyroidism
  • Hypothyroidism
  • Insomnia
  • Iron Deficiency
  • Irritable Bowel Syndrome
  • Nummular Dermatitis
  • Obesity
  • Pigment disorders
  • Plantar fasciitis
  • Rheumatoid arthritis
  • Rosacea
  • Sleep apnea
  • Snoring
  • Stasis Dermatitis
  • Stress management
  • Turner syndrome
  • and more…
Mental health

Our doctors are available to provide advice and treatment for common mental health conditions.

Some examples include:

  • Anxiety
  • Addiction
  • Depression
  • Mental health
  • Mood changes
  • OCD
  • Seasonal affective disorder
  • Trauma & loss
  • and more…
Women’s/men’s health

Doctors can advise on family planning and treat conditions like urinary tract infections and erectile dysfunction.

Some examples include:

  • Bacterial vaginosis
  • Birth control prescriptions
  • Bladder Infection
  • Chlamydia
  • Crabs (Pubic lice)
  • Erectile Dysfunction
  • Genital Herpes
  • Genital Warts
  • Gonorrhea
  • Hair loss (alopecia)
  • HIV
  • HPV
  • Hypoactive sexual desire disorder
  • Premature ejaculation
  • Premenstrual issues
  • Sexually transmitted infections (STI’s)
  • Syphilis
  • Trichomoniasis
  • Urinary tract infections
  • Vaginitis
  • Yeast infections
  • and more…

See a specialist for your unique concerns.

Dermatology

Dermatologists specialize in skin, hair, nail, and mucous membrane disorders from head to toe.

Read more >

Pediatrics

Feeding issues, behavioural issues, growing pains, and more. Kids are tricky and pediatricians are trained to identify and treat their unique issues.

Read more >

Psychiatry

Mental illness can affect all areas of your life. Psychiatrists can diagnose you and prescribe medications that will help you feel like yourself again.

Read more >

Psychotherapy

Take care of your mental health. Psychotherapists can help you cope and manage stress, anxiety, depression and more.

Read more >

Naturopathy

When Western medicine isn’t enough, naturopathic doctors can help create a healing holistic treatment plan.

Read more >

Endocrinology

Endocrinologists help manage hormonal imbalances and any issues that can arise when hormones are out of whack.

Read more >

Functional Medicine

Looking for more than a checkup? Take a holistic approach to your health by speaking with a functional medicine practitioner.

Read more >

Respirology

Lung conditions like chronic cough, COPD and asthma are difficult to manage on your own. A respirologist can help.

Read more >

Sleep Therapy

Sleep is a learned skill. Sleep therapists can help you get the rest you need.

Read more >

Life Coaching

Need guidance in your life? A life coach can help. From goal setting to overcoming challenges, you can go a long way by talking with an expert.

Read more >

Lactation & Breastfeeding

Breastfeeding can be hard. Bad latches, tongue ties, low supply — lactation consultants can help you fix most breastfeeding issues.

Read more >

Diabetes Counselling

A diabetes diagnosis comes with many lifestyle changes. A diabetes nurse educator can help you manage the transition.

Read more >

Oncology Navigation

Cancer is complicated. Sometimes you need a second opinion and help navigating the system. Speaking with an oncologist can help.

Read more >

Hemorrhoid Surgery Consultation

Hemorrhoids are extremely common. Review your options with a hemorrhoids expert and surgeon in less time than it takes to book an appointment.

Read more >

Gallbladder Surgery Consultation

Contemplating gallbladder surgery? Get an online consultation with a gallbladder expert and surgeon in 24 hours or less.

Read more >

Diet and Nutrition

Proper nutrition is the key to a healthy body. Speak to a nutritionist to design a food plan that fits your health needs today.

Read more >

See a specialist for your unique concerns.

Take care of your mental health. Psychotherapists can help you cope and manage stress, anxiety, depression and more.

Read more >

Breastfeeding can be hard. Bad latches, tongue ties, low supply — lactation consultants can help you fix most breastfeeding issues.

Endocrinologists help manage hormonal imbalances and any issues that can arise when hormones are out of whack.

Read more >

Read more >

Sleep is a learned skill. Sleep therapists can help you get the rest you need.

Read more >

When Western medicine isn’t enough, naturopathic doctors can help create a healing holistic treatment plan.

Read more >

Travel Medicine

International travel occasionally requires special medications and vaccines. Get them prescribed online, quickly and easily.

Read more >

Diabetes Counselling

A diabetes diagnosis comes with many lifestyle changes. A diabetes nurse educator can help you manage the transition.

Read more >

Diet and Nutrition

Proper nutrition is the key to a healthy body. Speak to a nutritionist to design a food plan that fits your health needs today.

Read more >

Frequently Asked Questions

How long are wait times to see a doctor on Maple?

Wait times to see a general practitioner are typically under two minutes. This makes it much easier to receive treatment for non-urgent health concerns, such as colds, minor injuries, or sexual health concerns. If you’re looking for an online pharmacy in Nunavut, our doctors can help with that too. They can fill your prescriptions and have them sent to your local pharmacy for pick up, or straight to your home address.

Can online doctors in the Nunavut write prescriptions?

Yes, most medical doctors on our platform can write prescriptions.

What health plans are available in Nunavut?

Residents of Nunavut are eligible for the Nunavut Health Care Plan. Unfortunately, virtual health care in Nunavut is not covered under the NHCP. Virtual health care is covered under many private insurance plans, such as employee benefits packages.

What specialists can I see in Nunavut with Maple?

Seeing a specialist is difficult in Nunavut because of a shortage of doctors and long travel times to receive treatment. With Maple you can see a wide variety of specialists in less than 72 hours, from the comfort of your home. It’s fast and easy to book an appointment with one of our specialists, and you don’t need a referral.

Patients love using Maple

Read our social media reviews, or download the app

Simple pricing to fit your needs.

Pay-per-visit

If you’re in a rush, or your family doctor is not available, you can use Maple for a single visit. The fee varies depending on the time of day.

$49 /visit

Weekdays

7am - midnight ET
Monday - Friday

$79 /visit

Weekends & Holidays

7am - midnight ET

$99 /visit

Overnight

Midnight - 6:59am

Year-round care

Enjoy the peace of mind of having a doctor on call 24/7. Memberships are paid annually.

$30 /month

Personal membership

Up to 30 visits per year

$50 /month

Family membership

Up to 50 visits per year

Credit packages

You can apply credits directly to a visit or membership. Get a discount by buying in advance.

Starter

$100 in credits

5% savings
Pay only $95

Extended

$200 in credits

10% savings
Pay only $180

Year-round

$500 in credits

15% savings
Pay only $425

Why do I have to pay if I’m Canadian?

Telemedicine visits are not widely covered by provincial health plans in Canada.

Learn more

Maple is safe and effective for common non-emergency issues. If you believe you are experiencing an emergency, please call 911 or proceed to your nearest emergency room.

Get started today.

Maple revolves around your needs and schedule. Start enjoying on demand healthcare that fits your life.

Register
